snippet: Syrian children at a refugee camp in Jordan performed Shakespeare’s “King Lear,” a tragedy that briefly took their minds off their own miseries.
abstract: Zaatari Refugee Camp Journal; 100 Syrian children at the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan perform in Shakespeare play King Lear; project attempts to address their experience of violence and years of missed education; parents, who say project is rare point of light for bleak camp existence, and aid workers fear Syria's war is creating a lost generation of children; about 60,000 young people live in the camp, where fewer than a quarter regularly attend school.
